units.title: Isolation of fresh crypts from human colon tissue
units.text: To clean the tissue and isolate fresh crypts for organoid generation, colon tissue was first sliced open lengthwise and wiped 3–4 times with gauze (Fisher Scientific) to remove waste and mucus. The tissue was then cut into small sections of ~2” × 2” and placed into a 15 cm dish filled with PBS++ (PBS supplemented with 10 mM HEPES (Thermo Fisher Scientific), 1X GlutaMAX (Thermo Fisher Scientific), 1X Pen‑Strep (Thermo Fisher Scientific), and 2.5 μg/mL Amphotericin B (Thermo Fisher Scientific)).
units.rationale: Describes the initial tissue preparation needed to obtain viable crypts for organoid culture.

units.title: Plating crypts in Matrigel droplets
units.text: crypts were plated in Matrigel droplets, at a density of 30–50 crypts per droplet. Once Matrigel had solidified for 30 min at 37 °C, crypts were fed with organoid growth media65: Advanced DMEM/F12 supplemented with 1X Pen‑Strep, 10 mM HEPES, 1X GlutaMAX, 1X B‑27 Supplement, 0.2 nM Wnt Surrogate protein, 5 nM Gastrin‑1, 1.25mM N‑Acetyl‑L‑Cysteine, 10 mM Nicotinamide, 100 µg/mL Primocin, 500 nM A 83‑01, 50 ng/mL recombinant human EGF, 100 ng/mL recombinant human Noggin, 250 ng/mL recombinant human R‑spondin 3, 100 ng/mL recombinant human IGF1, 50 ng/mL recombinant human FGF2, and with 10 µM Y‑27632.
units.rationale: Provides the step‑by‑step method for embedding crypts in Matrigel and initiating organoid growth.

units.title: Application of injury treatments (irradiation, DSS, cytomix)
units.text: For experiments involving irradiation, DSS, and cytomix, organoids were cultured as above in microwell plates for 5 days. On the 5th day after seeding, injury conditions were applied. For irradiation studies, the plates were placed on the center of the rotating table of the (137Cs) gamma irradiator) for the time periods equivalent to either 6 Gy or 12 Gy, and then the organoids were further cultured in the incubator. For DSS treatment, DSS (MP Biomedicals) was dissolved in organoid media (without EGF or Nicotinamide), and added to organoid wells overnight for 16 h, after which organoids were washed twice with Advanced DMEM/F12 and then replaced with organoid media.
units.rationale: Outlines how to induce specific injury modalities in cultured organoids.

units.title: FITC‑dextran permeability assay
units.text: FITC‑dextran (MedChemExpress) diluted to 2 mg/mL in PBS for 5 min in the incubator (37 °C, 5% CO2) for 30 min, after which organoid growth media with 10 µM Y‑27632 was added.
units.rationale: Describes the assay used to assess barrier integrity of organoids.

units.title: Immunofluorescence staining of organoids
units.text: For immunofluorescent images, organoids were removed from the Cultrex domes with 10 µM Y‑27632, fixed in 4% paraformaldehyde (Thermo Fisher) overnight at 4 °C on a rocker.
units.rationale: Specifies fixation conditions prior to antibody staining of organoids.

units.title: Single‑cell dissociation of organoids for scRNA‑seq
units.text: For scRNA‑seq experiments, organoids were dissociated using the Neural Dissociation‑P kit (Miltenyi). Organoids were pipetted out of their microwell plates and into a deep‑well 96 well plate (Thermo Fisher) for dissociation. Enzyme mix 1 was prepared according to manufacturer protocols with the addition of Y‑27632 for a final volume containing human recombinant proteins, and organoids were collected for scRNA‑seq on day 8 post‑seeding.
units.rationale: Provides the protocol to obtain single cells from organoids for sequencing.

units.title: Cell hashing for multiplexed scRNA‑seq
units.text: 1 µL of a unique cell hashing antibody (TotalSeqA: BioLegend) was added per condition for 20 min on ice, and cells were then washed three times with organoid wash buffer (0.1% Triton X‑100, 0.2% BSA (Miltenyi)) on ice.
units.rationale: Enables sample multiplexing and doublet detection in downstream scRNA‑seq.

units.title: CosMx spatial transcriptomics slide preparation
units.text: Slides were incubated with ER1 (AR9961, Leica) at 100 °C for 20 min. Subsequently, proteinase K (AM2546, Thermo Fisher) was applied at a concentration of 3 µg/mL for 15 min to enhance tissue permeability and facilitate probe hybridization.
units.rationale: Details key steps for preparing tissue sections for high‑plex spatial transcriptomics.

units.title: scRNA‑seq data processing pipeline
units.text: scRNA‑seq data was processed using CellRanger (v7.1.0). Count matrices were analyzed using Seurat (v5.0.2) in Rstudio. Cell type annotation was performed by applying FindTransferAnchors and TransferData using our matched colonic tissue reference atlas.
units.rationale: Summarizes the computational workflow for generating annotated single‑cell datasets.

units.title: Ligand‑receptor interaction analysis with CellChat
units.text: Ligand‑receptor interactions were assessed in each atlas using CellChat(v1.6.1) with trim = 0.02 and min.cells = 10.
units.rationale: Specifies the method and parameters used to infer intercellular signaling.
